Source.Name: autogen
Source.Summary: The automated text and program generation tool
Source.Description: autogen is a tool designed to simplify the creation and maintenance of programs that contain large amounts of repetitious text.

Update.Comment: Move more files to autogen-devel package. Remove system.devel dep, Version bump to latest stable version: - New in 5.11.8 - March 2011 * *Really* cope with Guile version number 2.0. * AutoOpts argument types of "time and date" have been added to the current support for time duration. - New in 5.11.6 February 2011 * Cope with Guile version number 2.0 * XML character encodings are parsed in config files * exit codes are enumerated for auto-opts projects, They will appear in an enumeration in the header file and in generated documentation. * program documentation templates have been improved. See docs. * packaging information: The PKGDATADIR and --with-packager... information are now compiled into the option structure. - New in 5.11.5 - December 2010 * When columns puts a special prefix on the first line, it now tests to see if it is longer than the indentation. * Fixed a fence post bug triggered by creating temporary strings 8160 through 8163 bytes long. * dependency output files should be readable by everyone. - New in 5.11.4 December 2010 * various test fixes: accommodate some severe brokenness in Solaris shells * Fix a seg fault on Solaris * Do not install .m4 files used to create configure script - New in 5.11.3 - November 2010 * new man page templates were added * usage information on usage errors may be suppressed * asprintf was introduced into libopts, but is not on all platforms. It has been removed.

Update.Comment: * Version bump: - Options may now be "deprecated". They get processed, but do not show in the usage output. - Options may be marked "no-command", meaning they are not to appear on the command line. Thus, they are recognized in config files only. - "disable-save" and "disable-load" may be used to prevent the command line options from loading or saving options from/to a file.
